Hi Liz,

This should be fine, 

We'll up the limit (to the max) and add an API for the French articles and check everything is still working

We did alter some stuff re. ownership of blog comments (as we have now dropped the UMS tables from our DB) so we'll need to modify that, but that's nothing too crazy.

Re. Performance, I think we should be fine, the issue is unlikely to be the load on the top level API's calls below (as these just list the pages to retrieve) but rather the subsequent requests for the complete pages (*). It would probably be preferable (ie. easier on the CMS) if those subsequent API requests were made sequentially, rather than in parallel. 

Have D3 already run a test with the smaller subsets below ie. pulled back the list of 50 pages and then made an API call for each of them? 

It would also be good to have some visibility on when D3 expect to retrieve the pages so that can check the CMS load at that point.

Jamie

(*) the API calls below just list the names and paths (and some top level info) for all the pages in the CMS, they do not contain the actual content for pages, this need to be retrieved separately via an additional API call.

Fab, thanks Jamie. I’ll pass on the sequential v. Parallel point.

And yes, given that 50 test articles and photos appeared in the D3 CMS a few weeks back, I think they did it all (and obviously without you even noticing ☺)

I’ll try to get them to let me know when they plan on doing the migration – I know broadly ‘next week’...

"given that 50 test articles and photos appeared in the D3 CMS a few weeks back, I think they did it all (and obviously without you even noticing ☺)"

Excellent... that was my line of thinking (ie. if the loaded them and we didn't notice)... although thinking back..... ;-) 

In all seriousness, I can't remember us being hit with any load issues in the past few weeks, still it would be good to be aware when D3 do it this time as the volumes are likely to be higher.
PS Jamie, how many days' effort shall we ask for the PO? (excluding the 3 days we have already claimed)

Hi Liz,

Have added an API to the French news stories
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-news-fr?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg 

Have also ammened the API's so that all pages are now retruned (rather than just the first 50)

Thanks, Jamie. So everything is ready to go!?

I think we’ll do the migration in the next day or two. I will let you know exactly when.

I think so.. as you say, let us know when your planning to do this as some questions are bound to pop up and it would be good to be around so that you can get them answered quickly.

Jamie

Jamie,

I just tried this link: https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-photos?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg And it doesn’t load anything (well, a blank page). Has the apiKey changed?

Hi,

Thanks for this

It looks like in adding this new webcam, the Olympic Stadium Camera 2 page – which I had deleted this morning – somehow reappeared.

It’s really important that this page does not appear on our website – is there a way this can be even more deleted?!

Thanks

Hi Michael,

You can't delete a webcam in the CMS, it will just re-appear when the feed next runs (the way the feed is setup it checks to see if the webcam exists and if not creates - or in this case - recreates it).

I will remove 'Olympic Stadium Camera 2' from the feed now..

Jamie

Ah I see. Yep great, if this could please be removed it’s be much appreciated!

Thanks very much

Hi Jamie,

Thanks for this. As I said, it’s really important this webcam never appears on our site again!!

On a related note, I’ve been shown this webpage – do you know anything about this, or how it’s generated in CMS? Again, we really need to kill this page

http://www.london2012.com/transform/1965137/m700x/stadium-close.jpg

Thanks,

Michael

Yes, thats a resizing of the image..

Althoguh we delete the page the image is still there, will look at removing it, but do be aware that (by default) removing a page doesn't expire an image used on it (so if someone knows the url they can get to the image.

I normal circumstances the image wont' be referenced - even in google - if there is no page on the site referencing it. I expect in the case of webcams people have been direct linking to the image).

I will remove it manually now.

Jamie

Great thanks very much

Michael

Should be removed now..
http://www.london2012.com/transform/1965137/m700x/stadium-close.jpg

Hi,

Further to this, please can we also delete this page/remove from feed permanently?

http://www.london2012.com/fr/webcams/webcam-2-du-stade-olympique.php

Thanks

Ah, well spotted..

Just removed it, although (just to confuse matters!!) unlike the English webcam pages you can actually delete the French webcam pages in the CMS / browse interface.

* the reason being is that the French webcam pages get created by a manual translation process / workflow and not by the webcam feed directly (so unless they are re-sent for translation they won't appear, and if the original english page has been removed, they can't be re-sent for translation).
Sounds good, thanks very much

More updates:

Looks like the 100 still are the same? And also, we appaer to be getting author's full names, not display names? See below:

This blog’s post, for example
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/blog/2007/06/judging-the-velopark-design-with-chris-hoy.php?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

contains only the author node filled with ‘Richard Arnold’ value instead of ‘Richard, Project Sponsor, Weymouth and Portland’.
I just tried the blog’s API with the “start” and “results” parameters and it’s still not working as expected (always showing the same 100 items).

________________________________

Hi Liz,

Really sorry, I triple checked (and then made a very tiny and supposedly insignificant change which - I assume - caused the start position to stop working again)

Should be OK now

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-blogs?start=100&results=100&apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-blogs?start=0&results=100&apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

In terms of the display name, you can only get that from the above URL/API

The actual page API will only return you the users name ie. ‘Richard Arnold’ (as that is all that is available via the page API call) as opposed to ‘Richard, Project Sponsor, Weymouth and Portland’.

Simple solution, is to pull the display name from the top level API call (and discard the one you get back from the page call)
Complex solution, we write a wrapper round the call to blog pages and add in the display name (we won't get that done today/tomorrow)

Alternatively, we could fairly easily send you a list of all display name <=> author's full name mappings?

Jamie

Ok, that is now working!

D3 would prefer:

For the display name, it would be great to have the list of all display name <=> author’s full name mappings.

Also, would it be possible to get the mapping for the JPG to use for each author thumbnails?

Thanks, Jamie

________________________________

Hi Liz,

Will try to get that over to you today, if not will have it to you for Monday.

Jamie

Hi Liz, See below... Hope this makes sense.. 1) A list of all Blog contributors / authors in this format (not all contributors have an image or biog) https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-blog-authors?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg Gemma is a Marketing and Communications Assistant for CLM, the ODA’s Delivery Partner. CLM’s role is to support the ODA in project managing the delivery programme for the venues and infrastructure for the 2012 Games.
2) I have updated the top level blog list API slightly to exclude the full contributors name as i) it is now available above ii) it greatly speeds up the API (meaning you no longer need to use pagination ie. start / result params) https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-blogs?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
Thanks!

You should be seeing them all now..

Hi Andy,

I've just received a couple of tickets from Andrew Chaplin about some of the Venues being misnamed. I've added the contents of the tickets below.

First ticket

"Hi Service Desk

I am doing a little work and using the London 2012 Completion schedules and the Olympic schedule still has the Handball Arena named as the 'Olympic Park-Handball Arena' and lists no sports competitions when selected.

However, when selecting 'Handball' from the sport drop-down list, the venue is displayed as the 'Copper Box'.

This will confuse the public, and I believe should be listed in the venue drop-down selections for both Olympic and Paralympic venues as the 'Copper Box'?

Regards,

Andy"

"Hi Service Desk

The same applies for the Hockey Centre, which should be the Riverbank Arena.

Going through the Competition schedules the Olympic and Paralympic schedules still have the Hockey Centre named as the 'Hockey Centre' and lists no sports competitions when selected. Andy"

comments.value: Could you configure https://festival.london2012.com not to re-direct requests for  to www.london2012.com, this task is a follow up to ticket #4601
<VirtualHost *:443> directive needed for festival. Kieran, ok if I leave this with you?
Although, post your conversation with BT, is this still one for us?
Russ, what do you want the behaviour to be?

Unless the certificate is a wildcard cert, it's not quite as simple as just adding a VirtualHost directive.
In fact, it's a lot trickier.
Basically, you can't do name-based virtual host matching over ssl (as - until the secure session is established, the "Host" http header can't be read).
There is no obvious front-runner solution for this:
   http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/ssl/ssl_faq.html#vhosts2
Possible solutions are:
 1. Make web01,02,05 listen to (e.g.) port 442, and use that to serve the festival site over SSL. This would require either the load balancer, or t Akamai to map port external:443->internal:442.

 2. Make web01,02,05 listen on two IP addresses. Apache would listen on CurrentIP:443 for the www site, and NewIP:443 for the festival site.

 3. (As mentioned at the start of the email) get a *.london2012.com certificate. Name-based VirtualHosts can then be used. See (for example) http://nostacktrace.com/dev/2010/1/30/apache-ssl-and-name-based-virtual-hosts.html

Kieran

It needs to remain on https - it is the thing we spoke about before where kitsite either need to create their own self signed certificate or just copy the london2012 one.  We are going to be moving the entire site to https even though the signup stuff is done through eDialog.
Russ, this is non-trivial. It is really one for BT, not us.
One other option: Dedicate one server to running https://festival and two for https://www

This support ticket has been automatically closed.

For support assistance please contact support@kitsite.com
For general information concerning Kitsite or PostCMS  please contact info@kitsite.com

thanks

Kitsite

Hi Susannah

1. The news on the home page is actually a separate include (see attached). 

Publishing the homepage doesn't re-publish the include.

Although publishing the new article /should/ publish the include (we looking at why that didn't happen)

Anyway, it's appearing now..
http://www.london2012.com/index.php

2) i think the reason the Local Leaders section has broken links is that some of that section was deliberately held back on the staging server at Morag's request.

The CMS has no way of knowing which pages have been held back on staging (as it is outside of the CMS and instead is part of the hosting setup) hence the broken links (as far as the CMS is concerned the page you are linking to is live and published).

The staging server isn't and was never intended to serve this purpose, it was simply to test out changes existing pages or hold back brand new sections before they got pushed live.

If you do use the staging server in this way ie. ask us to hold back individual pages/sections, if those pages are subsequently published you can't link to them from other pages in the CMS or else you'll end up with broken links.

In short holding parts of the site back on the staging server in this way leads to problems, especially it pages are held back for extended periods of time and/or mixed in with live pages.

The best way to handle pre-publish / preview is simply to not publish the pages and view then in the CMS via the preview button.

If the Local Leaders section is ready to go live now, we can remove an syncing-block (on staging) re-publish all the pages in that section, which should solve any issues with broken links.

Should we do that? can we publish all the pages the /get-involved/local-leaders/ section?

Jamie

The first point does seem to have resolved itself which is always good news.

Many thanks,
Susannah

Hi folks.

We've had a request from the Local Leaders team to make the social sharing functionality (as we currently have in the footer for Facebook and Twitter) more prominent and more specific.

If you look here: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/index.php you'll see there are 8 different 'products' which are going to make up the Local Leaders campaign as a whole ('Garden for the Games', 'Opening Night In' etc). As I understand it these products are going to have their own pages soon and the Local Leaders team want to embed clearly branded 'Like' and 'Tweet' buttons into the body of each page. They also want to make sure that


a)      The resulting pre-populated Facebook and Twitter posts contain more specific copy than just e.g. the page title. See here: http://mascot-games.london2012.com/#/customiser for where we achieved this for the mascot site (share buttons for Twitter and Facebook are in the bottom right)

b)      An appropriate thumbnail is pulled through on the Facebook post.

I know this raises a few issues that we've discussed previously:


1)      Can we resolve this Facebook thumbnail issue? Forgive the repetition as I know Danny in particular has explained the issue to me previously and we've put the idea of fixing it on hold. It would be great if you could remind me and give Tom an idea of what it would take to resolve this?

2)      Ditto re: how much we can customise the copy the content that is pre-populated into Twitter / Facebook posts.

The final question is can you please give me some estimates of how long it would take to do the work required (if possible?). The Local Leaders team are looking for an estimate.

Cheers all, hope that makes sense...

Finn Concannon (@finndc)

Hi Finn,

I'm trying to find my way though this ticket. Regarding

1) Can we resolve this Facebook thumbnail issue? Forgive the repetition as I know Danny in particular has explained the issue to me previously and we've put the idea of fixing it on hold. It would be great if you could remind me and give Tom an idea of what it would take to resolve this?

I am not sure what the Facebook thumbnail issue is but i would guess that you'd like a title/description/image meta data for for every page on london2012? 

Can you sort me out with these details:

- title: { kitsite: get pageTitle }
- type : could you pick one: http://developers.facebook.com/docs/opengraph/#types 
- url: { kitsite: url }
- image: we could have a generic image like the 2012 olympics logo or a generate a thumbnail for each page ()
- site_name: suppose this is "London 2012"
- description: i would say we use the "meta_desctiption" field for this as we do for the normal meta:description field, i think i would make sense to keep them consistant 

Thanks
Lars

Hey all, just picking this up after I dropped the ball a bit in the run up to Xmas

Lars said: "I am not sure what the Facebook thumbnail issue is but i would guess that you'd like a title/description/image meta data for for every page on london2012?"

Correct. Currently most pages on London2012.com don't pull through the right details on Facebook posts. We usually get the page title and a vaguely relevent meta description (which is fine, as these can be edited anyway) but the only thumbnail that ever gets to be pulled through (if any) is our permanant advertising banner that is site wide. If tou look at the attachment to this message you'll see it's currently pulling in the 'get ready to celebrate' banner from our site which has nothing to do with the page we're linking to.

I wasn't sure whey you're asking me for those details? Do you need that for every single page on the site if we want this to work site wide rather than just on the Local Leaders pages? That'll be a seriously big task. Is there no way to code the page so that Facebook gives users the choice of using any image on the page as a thumbnail? I don't know if you remember the old homepage of the Festival site (at www.london2012.com/festival which was a grid of lots of different images. Facebook used to give you the option to cycle through any of those images and choose which one went into the post (this post from a few months back is an example of that. The thumbnail was taken directly from www.london2012.com/festival, which you'll see is linked in the post: http://www.facebook.com/london2012festival#!/london2012festival/posts/131481493602063

Thoughts on the above, folks?

PS - I found this in an old ticket that closed because it got old...

"Probably the correct way to solve this issue is to use Facebook's Open Graph Protocol: http://developers.facebook.com/docs/opengraph/ 

This would not mean changing the facebook code at all, but it would mean adding code to the header of the page.
We could probably add a single "<meta property="og:image" content="http://www.london2012.com/some-image.jpg"/>" to the top of all pages. 

Alternatively, we could probably allow the content of this tag to be specified page by page, but this would add an extra layer of editorial effort and require a bit of coding.

The simplest approach would be a single new metatag to be added to all pages which could possibly be done in under a day (almost all of which would be confirming this approach will work, testing and deployment, rather than actual development).

Other approaches would take more time, depending on what we actually ended up doing."

I don't think a one-size-fits-all approach to the metadata that's pulled into Facebook will work, it needs to be context specific. Does that mean I need to choose the pages we're most likely to link to and provide the metadata we'd like for each one?

Hey Finn, I'm testing this since a couple of days :) I've written a logo pulling function and hooked it up to the meta-description field, so we can use the existing data?! It has caused me some problems with pages that have no meta-data description. I'd like to give it one more day to see eventual problems appearing. 

It should be on every page in preview looking like this:

         <meta property="og:title" content="About us | London 2012" />
         <meta property="og:type" content="game" />
         <meta property="og:url" content="http://www.london2012.com/about-us" />
         <meta property="og:image" content="http://www.london2012.com/images/logos/logo-para.png" />
         <meta property="og:site_name" content="London 2012" />
        <meta property="og:description" content="How was the bid won? Where's the money coming from? Who's making it all happen? The 'About us' section answers all this and more..." />
         

so far so good ~

1. If there is no meta-desciption, shall we display a generic one?
2. is og:image ok to use the logo for this section, we could add a meta field for this or try to get the first image in the page resized ( quite small tho )

Let me know your thoughts
Lars

Hey Lars, this is great, thank you.

“I've written a logo pulling function and hooked it up to the meta-description field, so we can use the existing data?!”

Cool, sounds sensible. Users can edit that anyway, we just need something to appear to begin with.

“If there is no meta-desciption, shall we display a generic one?”

Yep – “Visit London2012.com” should do. Any way you can let me know which pages are missing metadescriptions and which aren’t? And would it be ok for me to specify some pages that I know we’ll definitely need a specific meta-description adding to?

“is og:image ok to use the logo for this section, we could add a meta field for this or try to get the first image in the page resized ( quite small tho )”

That idea about resizing the first image on the page would be ideal. Appreciate it’s going to be small. Ideally I could specify some pages where we know that a certain image would be best to use as well?

Hey Finn,

Re: Any way you can let me know which pages are missing meta-descriptions and which aren’t? 

I've done a search, we have > 5000 pages with and > 5000 pages without the meta-descition field filled in ( i limited the search to 5000 so the cms would not slow down for you guys ) I think maybe its best to pick pages maybe via google analytics that make sense to have a meta-desctiption and check them manually?

Also! I think for pages that have a lat-lon location set in the page meta-data ( as i think most of the sport-locations have this ) i think we should include this data in the facebook og:data as well. What you think? 

Also 2! Same for videos, shall we use the opengraph video tags on video pages?

I am currently working on the image resizing.

Let me know,
Lars

subject: 'Share' functionality embedding into Local Leaders pages on London2012.com
description:
Hi folks.

We've had a request from the Local Leaders team to make the social sharing functionality (as we currently have in the footer for Facebook and Twitter) more prominent and more specific.

If you look here: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/index.php you'll see there are 8 different 'products' which are going to make up the Local Leaders campaign as a whole ('Garden for the Games', 'Opening Night In' etc). As I understand it these products are going to have their own pages soon and the Local Leaders team want to embed clearly branded 'Like' and 'Tweet' buttons into the body of each page. They also want to make sure that


a)      The resulting pre-populated Facebook and Twitter posts contain more specific copy than just e.g. the page title. See here: http://mascot-games.london2012.com/#/customiser for where we achieved this for the mascot site (share buttons for Twitter and Facebook are in the bottom right)

b)      An appropriate thumbnail is pulled through on the Facebook post.

I know this raises a few issues that we've discussed previously:


1)      Can we resolve this Facebook thumbnail issue? Forgive the repetition as I know Danny in particular has explained the issue to me previously and we've put the idea of fixing it on hold. It would be great if you could remind me and give Tom an idea of what it would take to resolve this?

2)      Ditto re: how much we can customise the copy the content that is pre-populated into Twitter / Facebook posts.

The final question is can you please give me some estimates of how long it would take to do the work required (if possible?). The Local Leaders team are looking for an estimate.

Cheers all, hope that makes sense...

Marking a high.
This is working now in the general content template and the local leaders template! 0.2

From Morag:

1. Rendering error. See e.g. https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games/garden-for-the-games-2.php

2. Did you know box. Could we make this optional. so that it doesn't appear on the page if no content is entered.

1. Rendering issue fixed. 

2. "Did you know" boxes should not display if there is no content in them. If you are seeing boxes with no content, then please give us details and we will investigate.
Is it possible to make the Did you know boxes optional today?
Morag, they should already be. Could you give us an example of where one isn't and we will investigate.
Oh, I will do so...
Morag, we have just spotted an issue with the template's new use of includes, which we are addressing now, We will get back to you shortly.

Hey Morag, 

I've amended the "Local leaders hub" in a way that it now looks for an "/includes/image-scroller.php" relative to the page. 
There's a new folder so i decided to just put it in there to show how it goes:

Folder: https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/folder/get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games-new2
Page: https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games-new2/index.php

This should be working now, is that the way you wanted it to be?
If so lets talk about those who boxes next :)

Cheers
Lars

That looks good, thanks. NB it’s not the Who box which is a problem – it’s the Did you know fact box. Currently it displays in preview even when there is no content in it – is it definitely the case that it won’t display when live?

Danny,

To follow up on our conversation earlier, attached is the proposed structure for this section.

Is this going to create problems by using the hub page too many times?

Re: use of the normal hub template, they only wanted that one because they wanted only one image at the top.

Grateful for your thoughts

Danny

Attached is a structure for the Local Leaders section, indicating which templates would be used.

Please can you review and advise if this structure would cause problems?

Morag
Hey Morag, i'm looking into the did you know issue!
I feel i got this working now, so the box disappears if not filled in.
Great – thanks!
And to answer your question about section structure, the proposed layout is almost certainly going to be fine. Please do proceed and let us know if you encounter any problems.
Perfect

Hello

Is publishing for all the Local Leaders pages set up only to publish to staging? Just want to be sure before we publish anything.

Think we need to get these pages live today – will let you know when as I know we need a bit of time to retire the old pages.

I can confirm that /get-involved/local-leaders/ section is locked down and not publishing to live. Let us know when you are ready to put the new content in the correct place (it probably shouldn't stay in garden-for-the-games-new2).

Is it possible to add a bottom image scroller (like that featured on the Inspire hub page) to the Local Leader hub page as an include? I can’t work out if there should be one there already – is it generic on hub pages?

Thanks!

Hey Morag, the container displaying this seemed a little dated, I've changed some things and added it to the local leaders hub. It looks for a folder called hub-promos and orders its content by name. The files to add to the hub-promos folder use the "Include - Hub promo" template. 

I've created a test one here:
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/folder/get-involved/local-leaders/opening-night-in

I think it should work fine, let me know if you have any troubles with it.
Thanks,
Lars

Ready to publish some (not all) the pages now, please!

We’d like to do the following:

Make ‘Local Leaders new’ the new ‘Local Leaders’ hub page
Publish ‘Line the Streets’ to live
Publish the whole of ‘Garden for the Games’ to live (can you remove the odd ‘2’ which has appeared in the section header?)
Publish ‘Planning your event’ to live

The other sections/pages should not be pushed to live yet.

Please could you do this as soon as possible?

Morag
I will do this now!

Hi Lars

Is this now live?

Hey Morag, it seems complicated to let only certain files through, we are looking into finding a way of how to do it.

Will update you on this asap!
Ah, understood. Okay – keep me updated, please!

This is a list of pages to be allowed to go through:

get-involved/local-leaders/line-the-streets/includes/image-scroller.php
get-involved/local-leaders/line-the-streets/index.php
get-involved/local-leaders/planning-your-event/index.php
get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games/index.php
get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games/grow-a-london-2012-meadow.php
get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games/grow-for-gold.php
get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games/local-leader-gardening-stories.php
get-involved/local-leaders/garden-for-the-games/includes/image-scroller.php

Hi Morag, we have found a way to publish those pages only and they should now be live now. 
The index page might have slipped through, is that going to cause a major problem?

Think you wanted the index page to be published as well thought so maybe its all good,
Let me know
Lars

Hi there

Looks good – but the links to the Garden for the Games sub pages are broken. Think this is because the section name is wrong (it has a 2 in it). Could you review please?
Hey Morag, i think we fixed it now but it took a quiet a bit of hand-picking. It looks good on btweb1 and should be find on the live site in a minute!

This looks great, Lars – thank you very much for sorting it out!

Have a good weekend!
Marking as solved.
